perturbation.original_text:
1. Definitions. As used herein, the following terms shall be defined as set forth below:

a. "Contract Period" shall mean that period of time from February 21, 2011 through December 31, 2012.

b. "Contract Year" shall mean the specific period of time during the Contract Period as more specifically set forth below:    路 Contract Year 2011 (2/21/11 - 12/31/11)    路 Contract Year 2012 (1/1/12- 12/31/12)
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Definitions. As used herein, the following terms shall be defined as set forth below:

a. "Contract Period" shall mean that period of time from February 21, 2011 through December 31, 2012.

b. "Business Year" shall mean the specific period of time during the Contract Period as more specifically set forth below:    路 Business Year 2011 (2/21/11 - 12/31/11)    路 Business Year 2012 (1/1/12- 12/31/12)
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Contract Year' is a key term defined in Section 1. By replacing it with 'Business Year' in the definition section, without explicitly stating that they are the same, creates confusion and could lead to disputes. Later references to 'Contract Year' may now be ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text:
6. Use of F2 Wedges/Using F2 Golf Bag. During the Contract Period and within the Contract Territory, North agrees to:

a. Wedges. Use Company's F2 branded wedges when competing professionally, conducting public clinics or outings, participating in  public golf events and when appearing at other public functions where it is appropriate to use or have golf clubs at such events (herein  "Public Events').
perturbation.changed_text:
6. Use of F2 Wedges/Using F2 Golf Bag. During the Contract Period and within the Contract Territory, North agrees to:

a. Wedges. Use Company's F2 branded wedges when competing professionally, conducting public clinics or outings, participating in  public golf events and when appearing at other public functions where it is appropriate to use or have golf clubs at such events (herein  "Promotional Engagements').
perturbation.explanation: Here, "Public Events" which is a key term dictating the scope of required appearances is now replaced by "Promotional Engagements" in the same clause. The difference can create uncertainty regarding the type of appearances covered

perturbation.original_text: North acknowledge that they do not now have and in the future will assert no right, title, or interest of any kind or nature  whatsoever, in or to any component of the Advertising Materials. Furthermore, subject to North's approval as set forth in section 8 above,  Company shall have the right at any time during the Term of this Agreement to make any revisions to the Advertising Materials or prepare  versions of all or any part of the Advertising Materials to conform to the requirements of individual markets or customers.
perturbation.changed_text: North acknowledges that they do not now have and in the future will assert no right, title, or interest of any kind or nature  whatsoever, in or to any component of the Marketing Content. Furthermore, subject to North's approval as set forth in section 8 above,  Company shall have the right at any time during the Term of this Agreement to make any revisions to the Advertising Materials or prepare  versions of all or any part of the Advertising Materials to conform to the requirements of individual markets or customers.
perturbation.explanation: In Section 9, switching from 'Advertising Materials' to 'Marketing Content' in the first sentence, while retaining 'Advertising Materials' in subsequent sentences, introduces inconsistency. This makes it unclear whether 'Marketing Content' and 'Advertising Materials' refer to the same thing. This could affect the ownership rights.
